fields.name: Limbo
fields.description: You float in a formless void, detached from all sensation of physical matter, surrounded by swirling glowing light which fades into the relative darkness around you without any trace of edge or shadow.

fields.name: The Stage
fields.description: You're standing on a theatre stage. Bright light blinds you. Is there anyone in the audience? Hard to say. There is an air of expectation, a lacuna.

fields.name: Foyer
fields.description:
The foyer is rather grand, if suffused with something of a sense of glory long faded. There are cobwebs on the Damoclean chandelier, and gold paint peeling from the banisters of the giant staircases leading up to the circle. It's a graceful ruin.

The ticket office is closed, and has been for some time if that skeleton is anything to go by.

fields.name: Backstage
fields.description:
Clearly no-one from Health and Safety has been here in a long time. Or someone has and they were killed by falling rigging before they could report back. Dusty ropes and broken glass litter the floor while the rigging continues to threaten overhead.

A short passage leads to a fire exit of the unalarmed variety. At least, it looks pretty calm.

fields.name: Back alley
fields.description:
Evidently this is the neighbourhood for which the word "insalubrious" was coined. There's evidence of life here, but only in the form of recently half-eaten dead things. Overflow from the drains is pooling on the pavement and appears to be slowly dissolving it. There's very little lighting down this alley, and frankly it would be better if there were none.

The door back inside snicks shut, prompting a brief panic. But it's not locked.

fields.name: Really dark bit of the alley
fields.description: It's very dark here. Which is probably a small mercy. All you can hear is the gentle drip, drip, hiss of battery acid, and the scrape of tiny claws on concrete. Lots and lots of tiny claws.

fields.name: Busy street
fields.description:
It really is bustling out here. Late night shoppers are hurrying towards their next retail experience; tourists clog the pavement clutching their locally-themed ephemera. Buses and cabs vie for control of the street, while cyclists heedlessly stream past and through.

The front of the theatre is lit spectacularly, suggesting enticing delights awaiting within. Which is weird. Certainly no-one is being enticed, or emerging delighted.

On the next block there's a pleasantly olde-worlde-looking pub, with hanging plants and everything.

fields.name: The Chap and Chaos
fields.description: This is very much an old man's pub. The booths are lined with crackled leather seats, and the seats are lined with dour-faced men mumbling into pints. Through a sort of saloon door there's a sports bar, with an ancient television tuned to the racing. Somehow the overall effect is quite cheering.
The prompt is standing away in the wings, alternating his attention between the action on stage, the prompt book, and his mobile phone.

Is flying around, whispering to himself:
   http://identi.ca/theinsanebird
The Bird looks at you and says: I tell you nothing!
